name: Distribution Alignment Decoder (DAD)
tagline: A distribution-alignment based approach for brain decoding
body:
### DAD
DAD is an approach for brain decoding which aims to decode movements from neural activity. This repository contains code and neural datasets to run DAD and compare its performance with supervised approaches.

If you use any of the code or datasets here, please cite our preprint:
EL Dyer, M Gheshlaghi Azar, HL Fernandes, M Perich, L Miller, KP K\"ording: __Cracking the neural code: A cryptography-inspired approach for brain decoding__, [preprint](https://www.dropbox.com/s/qqdabo7drryq42m/Dyer_DAD2016.pdf?dl=0), May 2016. 

### Support or Contact
If you have questions, please contact edyer\{at\}northwestern\{dot\}edu
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
